column4: Hey there, I've looked at many .screenrc files on the Internet, and not one of them tells me how to bind my mouse buttons to certain functions.  Basically, I want to turn copy-mode on and off using my mouse buttons 4 and 5, but I don't know how to bind the buttons to certain functions!  Can anyone tell me how to do this?  Thanks!
I don't think screen interacts with a mouse at all
actually it does have limited mouse support but it isnt mentioned in the manpage

and erUSUL, thanks... kind of a shame though, currently I can scroll with the mouse wheel in copy mode, it would just be very nice to activate and deactivate the mode with mouse buttons, much like binding key presses... maybe I can translate mouse buttons into key presses using Xmodmap??
the scrolling feature is implemented in VT, not in screen itself as far as I know
imo if you are the kind of person that uses screen to the point of writing your own rc files, you may want to get AWAY from the mouse
I'm actually using gnome-terminal with screen.  When copy mode is off, the mouse wheel scrolls the command history.  With copy mode on, I can scroll in the scroll-buffer.
oh. Then you may want to apt-get source screen and look at the Ubuntu-specific patches
I don't think I'll ever get away from using the mouse - I'm using screen mainly for its detachability, it's really awesome
thanks. I'll look at those ... but perhaps I'll look at xmodmap first and map button presses to keystrokes
you would. You'll get hooked on emacs and you'll despise everything GUI ;>
I do use emacs, but I still like to have it in windows ;P
I am on Windows right now and I am not using my mouse at all
wow.  But why stay away from using a mouse?  Pointing and clicking is inherently convenient in many situations
because switching hands interrupts thought flow
never heard that before.  Sounds interesting though. :)
generally, knowing basic emacs/shell keys makes you productive in many, many applications
do you use the emacs shell?

in the time between your and mine last line, I switched to MSN to write a couple of lines to the boss, jumped to a box to start the bots, and opened a new term with manual pages - interaction non-stop
yeap
